source.20c8b104:
import os

import pandas as pd
from pathlib import Path
source.661e255e:
%%time
datadir = Path('../input/liverpool-ion-switching')
train = pd.read_csv(datadir / 'train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv(datadir / 'test.csv')
submission = pd.read_csv(datadir / 'sample_submission.csv')
source.7af1c7fa:
%%time

# --- save feather format ---
outdir = Path('.')
os.makedirs(str(outdir), exist_ok=True)
train.to_feather(outdir / 'train.feather')
test.to_feather(outdir / 'test.feather')
submission.to_feather(outdir / 'sample_submission.feather')
source.b715fcfc:
%%time

# --- check reading ---
train2 = pd.read_feather(outdir / 'train.feather')
test2 = pd.read_feather(outdir / 'test.feather')
submission2 = pd.read_feather(outdir / 'sample_submission.feather')
source.e07c384b: Let's check how fast to read the data with feather format, it takes about **only 100 milli-sec** to read data!
source.40bd2ce7:
# Liverpool ion switching: convert to feather format for fast data loading

We can load much faster with feather format, instead of using csv.

This data is uploaded to [Liverpool ion switching feather](https://www.kaggle.com/corochann/liverpool-ion-switching-feather). You can press "Add Data" button on top-right and search "liverpool-ion-switching-feather" to use this feather format data.
source.426eeeab: It takes 3 sec to read data with the original csv format.
